records.location_details: A rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants was detected by a Danish helicopter south of Chios in Greek territorial waters. The incident was later concluded on the Turkish side as a prevention of departure.
records.where_clear: South of Chios, Greek territorial waters
records.location_text_raw: south of Chios in Greek territorial waters
records.uncertainty_note: Location details redacted in the form. The 'Fact of the case' states detection 'south of Chios in Greek territorial waters', but Greek authorities reported the incident concluded in 'Turkish territorial waters' as a 'Prevention of Departure'. The assessment notes information indicating a possible location in Greek territorial waters within the JO Poseidon operational area, despite the reported conclusion on the Turkish side.

possible_violations.violation_name: Alleged violations of Fundamental Rights or international protection obligations

records.context_note: On 27.07.2020, a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) arrived and took over, after which the Danish asset departed. JRCC Piraeus informed MRCC Ankara. According to Greek authorities, a Turkish patrol boat subsequently took responsibility for the incident in Turkish territorial waters, and ICC Piraeus registered it as a 'Prevention of Departure'. A Danish National Official (NO) reported a possible serious incident, questioning the reported location. Discussions in ICC Piraeus (JCB) referred to a misunderstanding, suggesting the request to change location was only for initial detection in Turkish TWs. Frontex is launching a SIR procedure due to information indicating a possible location in Greek territorial waters, despite the reported conclusion on the Turkish side as a prevention of departure.
records.evidence_quote: On 27.07.2020 at 06:21LT a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approx. 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters.
